TEXT: The applicant is a NORP national , born in DATE , and resides on the isle of GPE , GPE . He is represented by Mr E.Th . ORG , a lawyer practising in GPE , the GPE .

On DATE , acting on information received that behind the X. snack on the isle of GPE drugs were being sold , the police officers GPE and GPE conducted an investigation on that location . Upon their arrival there , they saw CARDINAL men , CARDINAL of whom the applicant .

According to the applicant , the CARDINAL police officers searched him in public while he was made to stand facing a wall with his trousers and underpants lowered until the knees . No drugs were found on him . When the applicant refused to comply with the police officers ' subsequent order to remove his underpants , he was arrested and taken to the police station

According to the formal police record ( proces - verbaal ) on this investigation , the police officer PERSON saw that the applicant gave a small object to the other person present who gave the applicant a banknote in return . The applicant added this banknote to a bundle of notes , which he then put in his pocket . The police officers apprehended the applicant . The other person absconded . The officers searched the applicant . No drugs were found on him . An amount of CARDINAL Antillean Guilders found on him was seized . While searching the applicant , the police officer GPE saw the applicant hide an object in his underpants . The applicant was arrested and brought by car to the police station . When the applicant got out of the car at the police station , he dropped a plastic bag on the floor . The police officer PERSON picked up the bag and secured it . The bag was found to contain QUANTITY small plastic sachets each containing cream - coloured powder .
Subsequent tests indicated that the powder found contained cocaine . Following his arrest , the applicant was placed in pre - trial detention .
By summons of DATE , the applicant was ordered to appear on CARDINAL DATE before ORG ( PERSON in PERSON ) sitting in GPE on charges of possession of and trafficking in narcotics .

On DATE , ORG started its examination of the case . The defence stated that it had summoned PERSON , GPE , PERSON and GPE in order to be heard as witnesses , but that only GPE had appeared . It granted the request by the prosecution to stay the proceedings in order to take evidence from these persons . It adjourned its examination until DATE .

On DATE , Mr PERSON gave evidence before the investigating judge ( rechter - commissaris ) . PERSON and PERSON gave evidence before the investigating judge on DATE . All CARDINAL witnesses confirmed that , on DATE , the QUANTITY police officers had forced the applicant to lower his pants and underpants when they searched him .

On DATE , the prosecution sought a further stay , as it wished to verify certain allegations which had been made against the police . The prosecution further stated it wished to hear as witnesses the police officers GPE , GPE and J. The defence did not object to a further stay , but requested the applicant 's release from pre - trial detention . ORG adjourned the case until DATE , ordered that the police officers GPE , GPE and J. be heard before the investigating judge and further ordered the applicant 's immediate release . The applicant was released on DATE .
On DATE , upon the request of both the prosecution and the defence , ORG adjourned the proceedings until DATE in order to hear PERSON as a witness .
On DATE , ORG adjourned its examination until DATE as the witness ORG had not appeared . It ordered that this witness be forcibly brought before it on DATE .

On DATE , ORG took evidence from the applicant , who denied the charges . It further took evidence from ORG , who stated inter alia that he had bought CARDINAL sachets of base ( cocaine ) from the applicant shortly before the latter was arrested on DATE . He himself had walked away . He further stated that he never bought any drugs from the applicant previously . He also stated to have been beaten by the police upon his arrest as he had refused to talk . Both the prosecution and the defence were given the opportunity to put questions to this witness .

ORG further considered various other means of evidence , including the formal police records of the investigation carried out on DATE and statements made to the police officer PERSON on DATE by GPE and GPE respectively , who had each declared to have bought base from the applicant . The court of ORG further heard the parties ' final pleadings and closed its investigation .

In its judgment of CARDINAL DATE , ORG convicted the applicant of trafficking in narcotics and sentenced him to DATE imprisonment with deduction of the time spent in pre - trial detention . The applicant filed an appeal with ORG of GPE and GPE ( FAC en GPE ) .

On DATE , ORG of Appeal heard the applicant , who stated to be innocent , and considered the means of evidence before it , including formal police records concerning the investigation of CARDINAL DATE , the report of ORG containing the findings of the test carried out on the powder found on DATE , a statement made to the police officer PERSON on DATE by PERSON , who had stated to have bought base from the applicant , statements made to the police officer PERSON on DATE by GPE and GPE respectively , who had each declared to have bought base from the applicant , and a statement made to the police officer PERSON on DATE by GPE , who had stated to have bought base from the applicant . ORG of Appeal further heard the parties ' pleadings and closed its investigation .

By judgment of DATE , ORG of Appeal quashed the judgment of CARDINAL DATE , convicted the applicant of trafficking in narcotics and sentenced him to DATE imprisonment with deduction of the time spent in pre - trial detention .

ORG rejected as not having been made plausible the assertion by the defence that the evidence against the applicant had been fabricated and that the finding of the cocaine had been faked . It found no reasons to doubt the veracity of the facts and circumstances as related in the formal police records .

It further rejected the argument of the defence that the statements of the witnesses GPE , GPE , GPE , GPE , GPE , and ORG could not be used in evidence on grounds that their statements concerned different facts . ORG considered that these statements mutually support each other , since they concern similar facts . The court added that these statements were only used in conjunction with the other means of evidence . It further rejected the argument by the defence that the witness PERSON had been afraid to retract his statement for fear of being prosecuted for perjury . The court held that it had not appeared that this statement had not been made freely . It added that this was also the case with the other statements used in evidence ,
The applicant filed an appeal in cassation with ORG ( PERSON ) . Pursuant to LAW ( Wet op de Rechterlijke Organisatie ) an appeal in cassation is limited to points of law and procedural conformity .

In his appeal in cassation , the applicant complained that the prosecution should have been declared inadmissible on grounds that the applicant 's rights under LAW had been violated in that the police officers had forced the applicant to lower his pants and underpants on a public place . The applicant further complained under LAW that the Joint Court of Appeal had unjustly rejected his argument that the evidence against him had been fabricated and that the finding of the cocaine had been faked . He also complained under LAW that he would have to serve his sentence in the NORP prison on the isle of GPE , where the conditions of detention , according to the findings of ORG for the Prevention of Torture and Inhuman or Degrading Treatment in its Report ORG ( CARDINAL)CARDINAL of DATE , constitute inhuman and degrading treatment .

In his advisory opinion to ORG , the Procurator - General ( ORG ) to ORG advised ORG to reject the first complaint on grounds that the defence had not raised this argument before ORG whereas in cassation proceedings no facts or circumstances can be invoked which have not been established before the trial courts . He further advised to reject the second complaint on grounds that the rejection by ORG of this argument was based on its comprehensible assessment of the facts , which can not be further reviewed in cassation proceedings . As to the third complaint , the Procurator - General noted that this complaint had not been raised before the trial court and considered that this issue could not be raised for the first time in cassation proceedings as this would require an investigation of the conditions in which prison sentences imposed by courts in GPE are habitually executed .

In its judgment of DATE , referring to LAW ( Wet op de Rechterlijke Organisatie ) , ORG rejected the applicant 's complaints in cassation without stating any further reasons . It further did not find any grounds on the basis of which the judgment of DATE should be quashed ex officio .
Article CARDINALa RO provides as follows :
< Translation >

" If ORG considers that a complaint submitted can not lead to cassation and does not prompt a determination of legal issues in the interest of legal unity and legal development , it can limit itself to this finding when giving the reasons of its decision on that point . "
